intro: Pharus scaber, commonly known as the rough pharus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
